attributes.action: reject the tax on telephone lines which has been proposed in order to pay for the provision of fast broadband serices to rural communities
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The use of satellites to deliver fast internet services would be a much better option than landlines for rural communities, albeit more expensive, but then why should all UK users of telephones (many of whom may not even have a computer, let alone internet access) have to pay for rural broadband? Most of it will be used for entertainment purposes, notbusiness or essential use.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
